definitions.definition: A slender jointed extremity of the human hand , (often) exclusive of the thumb .
examples: Humans have two hands and ten fingers . Each hand has one thumb and four fingers .

definitions.definition: Similar or similar - looking extremities in other animals , particularly :

subdefinitions.definition: The lower , smaller segment of an arthropod claw .
One of the supporting structures of wings in birds , bats , etc. evolved from earlier toes or fingers.
One of the slender bony structures before the pectoral fins of gurnards and sea robins ( Triglidae ).

definitions.definition: Something similar in shape to the human finger, particularly :

subdefinitions.definition: Finger- shaped pieces of food .
examples: chocolate fingers ; fish fingers ; cheese fingers

subdefinitions.definition: A tube extending from a sealed system, or sometimes into one in the case of a cold finger .
Synonym of foxglove ( D. purpurea ).
subdefinitions.label_groups: UK regional , botany , usually in the plural , obsolete

definitions.definition: Something similarly extending , ( especially ) from a larger body , particularly :

subdefinitions.definition: Various protruding plant structures , as a banana from its hand .
A lobe of the liver .
The teeth parallel to the blade of a scythe , fitted to a wooden frame called a crade .
The projections of a reaper or mower which similarly separate the stalks for cutting .
Clipping of finger pier ( “ a shorter , narrower pier projecting from a larger dock ” ) .
Synonym of jet bridge : the narrow elevated walkway connecting a plane to an airport .
A leaf in a finger tree data structure .

definitions.definition: Something similar in function or agency to the human finger, ( usually ) with regard to touching , grasping , or pointing .

subdefinitions.definition: Synonym of hand , the part of a clock pointing to the hour , minute , or second .
A policeman or prison guard .
An informer to the police , ( especially ) one who identifies a criminal during a lineup .
A criminal who scouts for prospective victims and targets or who performs reconnaissance before a crime .
That which points; an indicator , as of guilt , blame , or suspicion .
examples: The finger of suspicion pointed clearly at the hotel manager.

definitions.definition: Various units of measure based or notionally based on the adult human finger, particularly

subdefinitions.definition: Synonym of digit : former units of measure notionally based on its width but variously standardized , ( especially ) the English digit of ⁄ 16 foot ( about 1.9 cm ).
A unit of length notionally based on the length of an adult human 's middle finger , standardized as 4½ inches (11.43 cm ).
Synonym of digit : ⁄ 12 the observed diameter of the sun or moon , ( especially ) with regard to eclipses .
An informal measure of alcohol based on its height in a given glass compared to the width of the pourer 's fingers while holding it.

definitions.definition: A part of a glove intended to cover a finger.
Skill in the use of the fingers, as in playing upon a musical instrument .
Someone skilled in the use of their fingers, ( especially ) a pickpocket .
An obscene or insulting gesture made by raising one's middle finger towards someone with the palm of one's hand facing inwards.
labels: especially in the phrase 'give someone the finger'
definitions.label_groups: especially in the phrase 'give someone the finger'

definitions.definition: Any of the individual receivers used in a rake receiver to decode signal components.
An act of fingering ( inserting a finger into someone's vagina or rectum for sexual pleasure ) .

main_definition: ( anatomy ) A slender jointed extremity of the human hand , (often) exclusive of the thumb .
secondary_definitions: ( zoology ) Similar or similar - looking extremities in other animals , particularly :
Something similar in shape to the human finger, particularly :
Something similarly extending , ( especially ) from a larger body , particularly :
Something similar in function or agency to the human finger, ( usually ) with regard to touching , grasping , or pointing .
( units of measure ) Various units of measure based or notionally based on the adult human finger, particularly
( fashion ) A part of a glove intended to cover a finger.
( informal , obsolete ) Skill in the use of the fingers, as in playing upon a musical instrument .
( informal , rare ) Someone skilled in the use of their fingers, ( especially ) a pickpocket .
( especially in the phrase 'give someone the finger' ) An obscene or insulting gesture made by raising one's middle finger towards someone with the palm of one's hand facing inwards.
( radio ) Any of the individual receivers used in a rake receiver to decode signal components.
( vulgar ) An act of fingering ( inserting a finger into someone's vagina or rectum for sexual pleasure ) .
